item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Denver Housing Authority lottery day for Section 8 for 2021 is September 17th and 18th, 2020.

Not such big news... because..
If you win, your name goes on a waiting list. Yep you do not get housing for winning the the Denver Housing Authority lottery. You get your name on a wait list. Why are there restrictions for getting peoples name on a wait lists to begin with? You have to win a lottery just to have you name on a wait list. That is how bad housing has been for dec...ades. It takes lottery luck just to get your name on a years long wait list that usually winds up being years longer than reported it would take when your name is first placed on it.

for details on how to access the lottery click the link.

item.title: Sweep at 25th and Arapahoe Postponed... Residents relieved, but...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep at 25th and Arapahoe Postponed... Residents relieved, but still unsettled by pending sweep September 8th

Today, September 1st 2020, many residents of the camp at 25th and Arapahoe had already packed up and moved by the time we got the word from news reporters that they had been told by the city the sweep was postponed. Apparently the city choice to tell the news that the sweep was postponed, but not the residents of the camp. Shortly after, we confirmed in an email with... the Mayor's office that the sweep was in fact postponed. Just now (11am) DOTI posted a new notice for September 8th 2020.

The residents who still remained by the time we got this word were relieved about the postponement, but still anxious about the coming sweep and uncertainty of when...and mostly where they would move to to avoid more sweeps and police.

One resident, Ray, who has lived at this camp since April when they were advised to go there by DPD officers, explains the history of their time at this camp, how clean they have kept it, how the community cares for each other, how they have built relationships with the neighbors, and how crushed he is that even with all this the city would still sweep them just because they are homeless. Listen to his words here https://www.facebook.com/DenverHomelessOutLoud/videos/252937675765721

Listen to the residents cry for support in fighting for this camp - contact our city decision makers and share this demand... "Mayor Hancock, come out here and see for yourself how clean and peaceful we keep this camp."

Residents of this camp want housing but cannot afford $1000 a month. If we can't afford the rent, they shouldn't take our f*cking tent!!!

onward toward stability, rights, and housing for all...

item.title: Call for Funding for Portable Toilets and Sanitation Resources...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Call for Funding for Portable Toilets and Sanitation Resources for the Houseless Community!!

For the past 4 months we at Denver Homeless Out Loud have been paying for port-a-potties at 5 different encampments where people live on the streets with otherwise no access to a bathroom. We have asked the City to fulfill their responsibility and place portable toilets, handwashing stations, and trash cans at every encampment and they have continued to refuse. So we as a small commu...nity organization have had to front the bill for the few we could afford.

Thanks to a $25k grant from the Colorado Health Foundation for emergency COVID needs, we were able pay for 5 portable toilets, supplies for handwashing stations (in collaboration with Mutual Aid Denver (MAD), trash cans and bags for each toilet, sharps boxes, and compensation for people living on those blocks to clean the toilet units every day.

But we have now run out of those funds.

In order to keep providing the sanitation resources at encampments, we need some serious funding for this project ASAP!!

As long as the City continues to refuse to do their job, someone has to step up to do it for them. We need your help to make this possible.

In order to continue to run these port-a-potties and sanitation resources for the remainder of 2020 we need at least $25k. If we do not get at least 5k by September we will not be able to continue these resources. It costs us just over $800 a month for each regular portable toilet, and $1000 for an ADA toilet, plus moving charges after police sweeps, plus the pay for someone from the encampment to do an extra cleaning of it each day, plus cleaning supplies and supplies to build and maintain the handwashing stations.

Furthermore, in order to keep these resources available on the streets in 2021, we need at least $100k. This would enable us to maintain these resources in 2021, and if there were more funding we could expand these resources to more encampments and with more needed services.

These are basic human needs. The CDC guidance tells cities to provide these sanitation resources to every encampment of 10 people or more. Denver has not provided these for any encampment. As we continue to fight for the City to step up and do their job, we also ask the community for support in meeting this need.

Please contact us with any questions, donations, or ongoing funding.

Contact us at:

info@denverhomelessoutloud.org

720-940-5291

item.title: Another Houseless Sweep Planned for Tuesday WE NEED HOUSING NOT...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Another Houseless Sweep Planned for Tuesday

WE NEED HOUSING NOT SWEEPS

Neatly arranged tents ... trash neatly bagged etc it has bee this way for weeks ....
does this look like a health hazard to you...?

Many of the residents of the encampment at 25th and Arapahoe have been living there for over 5 month. They have never got a bad mark when health inspectors have come by. The camp is clean and well managed. We in DHOL pay for a port-a-potty at the camp and together with MAD maintain the handwashing station. Most residents are on housing waitlists or otherwise actively seeking housing - to no avail.

Yet, regardless the City is planning to sweep this group of about 50 people to nowhere on Tuesday. Some of the newer residents of this camp are here after moving from the sweeps at 22nd last week. They will be moved again with no solution as to where to go.

If you want to come support the residents of this camp please do. The voice of residents who are facing this trauma need to be heard. Be there to listen and stand in solidarity with those living on these blocks.

If you can...bring…
-Food
-Water
-Rope/bungee cords
-Carts
-Trash bags
-Signs demanding Housing not sweeps!

There are no health hazards here... the city is lying. The city is getting far to comfortable with this lie and they need to be stopped.

info@denverhomelessoutloud.org

item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Shelters Trashing Residents Property

These pictures show property of shelter residents at the 48th street shelter taken from residents who were not there for a night and trashed the next morning. The shelter has a practice of trashing the property of anyone who is not there for a night. They have storage bins for resident’s property but those bins will be emptied and trashed if you are not there for a night. Some residents are not there because they are at the hospital, or a... job, or for any other reason.

Below see pictures documenting the process of shelter staff trashing residents property, as well as an incident report from one of many residents who had their property trashed after going to the hospital.

item.title: 100 People without Housing Swept to Nowhere Today: Disabled Vet...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

100 People without Housing Swept to Nowhere Today: Disabled Vet Stands His Ground; Voices of Residents Must be Heard

Today, Wednesday August 26th, the city came back again at 5am to sweep away about 100 people from where many of them had been staying for months. Residents of this area were specifically told by police they did not know where they could move to. At least off camera they admitted the truth!@# Many people were in tears and turmoil trying to figure out where to mo...ve after the sweep. A couple people were given one or two night hotel vouchers...and than they will be back on the streets dealing with the same search for where to stay as they await housing to be made attainable.
3.jpg

Four protesters were arrested after being in the street briefly trying to film the situation. Police bumrushed them, brutally hurting at least two of them, and arresting 4 people simply for being in the street for a short time, most not even blocking traffic. A few minutes later, people were standing in the street doing the exact same thing right in front of police and none of them were arrested. Yet another example why money to fund police should be used on housing and resources, not police.

Hear the voices from the street.
Words from the Street...Before August 26th Sweep

"'It’s very stressful, this constant moving. "
"They are complicating our survival."
"We have a right to be here, we have a right not to go to the shelter with bed bugs."
"Fuck the Puereos"
"It makes me feel good that people care and are helping."
"I have no where to go."
"We are not cattle."
"Until they offer me a home, I will be in this spot with my tent."
"This is where my case manager can find me, my path to housing."
"Give me one logical reason why I have to move."
"The only way I will move my stuff is if they hand me a lease to an apartment. "

info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
